column2: gladtobealive, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I suffer from major depression and have had symptoms from a very young age but managed with counseling therapy off/on.  However, my conditioned worsened over time and I started taking medications for depression and suicidal thoughts for several years.  They helped but did not resolve the severe low depressive episodes until Deplin!  It started working a few weeks after taking it but I didn't realize it at first.  But then I noticed that my mood was more consistent and I did not have the severe lows. I am no longer fearful of the lows that I cannot overcome.  Deplin helps me!  The major symptom (?side effect)that I have noticed is that: 1. my parasympathetic system occasionally overeacts; headaches becomes very painful (rarely had them except for minor ones via sinus reactions)  2. on a couple of occasions I have had "hot flashes" (I am very post-menopausal and I never had hot flashes when I was going through the change) including perspiring profusely. 3. I often need to use a fan to circulate more fresh air.

column2: sunshine after rain, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a partial responder which means that when I take anti-depressants my body will have 1 1/4 times more of the medicine than most people and most of the negative side effects. Everything makes my heart palpitate and I get every horrible side effect and then some on the chart.My doctor started me on 15mg deplin 6 weeks ago and in the beginning I wasn't really sure what was happening.I felt something that felt sort of like panic but then after about 1 1/2 hours I could feel the calm kick in.Even .25 xanax gives me a panic attack during the first hour its in my system.Anyway, I have tried so many antidepressants,mood stabilzers and atypicals that I could start my own pharmacy and always had falure.I thought that I would have to take this with an antidepressant but it seems to be doing ok own its own.Dr. told me to add another 7mg daily.I have also added 250mg l-carnitine (an amino acid)for energy.Doing well I think and was able to go on a job interview yesterday and actually get hired.Just three weeks ago I was weepy and depressed and its great not having the panicky feeling from antidepressants as I already have major anxiety and depressive disorder which also presents itself as extreme irritability.I don't feel the deplin"kicking in" now its just a smooth transition.I think I was so low in the beginning that I felt every little change in my brain as a big change.I may have had a mild headache or two in the beginning but with all the pollen now its hard to say for sure.I hope this helps others like me that struggle so hard with medications and depression/anxiety.

column2: TigerLily, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I think it is safe to say that Deplin prevented me from being hospitalized again and probably saved my life. It was effective within 3 days instead of the 4-6 weeks of most other medications. I've had no side effects.I have suffered from treatment resistant/refractive depression, anxiety/OCD, PMS, fibromyalgia, myofascial pain syndrome PTSD and diabetes for many years. Initial treatment with Prozac for depression 21 years ago was extremely effective for about three years. Then it stopped working. For the past 18 years or so nothing has worked.I've been on antidepressants, Abilify, gabapentin, Lyrica (more for the fibro.). The cocktails were endless. The latest was trying Prozac again. Nothing, even with increasing the dose. Over the past year symptoms have increased and there is the possibility of perimenopause. My psychiatrist left the area when I was extremely unstable - extreme depression, rages, severe PMS, and suicidal because I'd given up hope anything would help. I was close to breaking up a 7 year marriage. I was basically dumped on my family doctor, who was unable to find assistance in treating me. Gotta love rural life. He gave me samples of 7.5 mg Deplin and within a couple days I was feeling better. After a couple weeks we bumped it up to 15 mg. I still can't believe how much better I feel. No PMS, no mood swings (not attributed to food). I still can't quite believe it. HOPE!!! I gave the information to my parents when I visited over Christmas. My dad is so miserable to be around. I hope he follows through and this helps. My mother has dopamine issues so maybe it would help.Cost is going to be a major factor for me and my parents. The insurance companies aren't wanting to pay. They'll pay for medications with nasty side effects, though. I don't understand. Even with Pamlab's assistance program the cost is still high.If you can get samples or your insurance will cover it, please give it a try. It might just save your life and relationships.

column2: Anonymous, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Been on it for a couple weeks now. Do feel differences for the better, but I am really having a hard time sleeping now. I'm taking Wellbutrin, which can also have that side effect, so I am wondering if it can be enhancing that. Also, I think I am gaining weight (though on the flip side I am less interested in an afternoon snack). Also more headaches and dryness in sinuses/throat. Time of year is probably not helping that, but the time of year doesn't explain why I feel so thirsty. Someone else claimed that since it's just a vitamin it cannot have side effects but if that were true why do we need a prescription to get it? And you can have too/take too much of some vitamins. And of course people can react to the inactive ingredients. Also, how SSRIs and other anti-depressants work are not well known/understood, and some of those can cause weight gain, etc. So why couldn't an increase in l-methylfolate cause similar symptoms? Maybe these side effects are a result of my body behaving the way it was supposed to be versus how it behaved with a chemical imbalance. I am seeing benefits from this, so I may continue to take it. Just feels like I found yet another drug that helps but I may have to stop takign it due to side effects.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started Deplin 7.5 mg/day about 1 month ago due to lethargy and sleeping several hours/day.  I take Zoloft 50 mg/day for anxiety/depression. I told my MD that I was just tired of being so tired!  She gave me a 30 day sample of Deplin, she said she had not prescribed it yet for anyone else, so I was her guinea pig.  I noticed a difference within the first week.  I didn't need a 2-3 hour nap in the afternoon and my energy level has increased enough to where I can take my dog on a 20-30 minute walk 4-5 days/week.  Hoping this can help me lose some weight. Also have started to taper off my zoloft, 50mg every other day alternating with 25 mg.  I just hope the effects of Deplin continue to help me improve.

column2: aura521, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The effect has been dramatic and unexpected. My motivation, memory, attention and concentration have improved. I am disabled by depression. I am hoping that this medication will allow me to go back to work. It is know to be ineffective in people who have no difficulty in processing folic acid from usual diet. 7 out of 10 depressed people have a problem making use of folic acid. I must be one of those people.  It is definatly worth trying.

column9: My mom started taking Deplin 6 days ago. She suffers from severe depression. She has lost 4 of her 6 siblings in the past 3 years, with the most recent in Dec 08. Should she still be taking the xanax and the lexipro with the deplin. I have read so many good things about delpin, but not sure if she should still be taking the other medications. Any help and/or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

column2: twitter: xLxExIxGxHx, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: [major impact/pricey]i had been very unresponsive to other medications for severe depression and i have recieved ECT treatments in the past (months ago) but those affects wore off and i cannot risk the short term memory loss. within a few weeks of taking deplin i could feel that my chemical depression was lifting. i am amazed by the impact a "medical food" or vitamin can have when i have been through every other drug possible. with most other meds i have had serious side effect problems but there is no side effects. the price is the bad part because the insurance doesn't cover it.

column2: KMC1968, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It took 3 weeks to start feeling effects of Deplin, but now I know it's well worth $60 a month. I've been able to decrease the amount of Lexapro I take nightly, I now have energy and the desire to participate in life, have drastically reduced the amount of cigarettes I smoke, feel calm and happier. My insurance doesn't cover this medicine and that's a shame because I honestly feel this is some sort of MIRACLE DRUG! I was very depressed/filled with anxiety. Now I'm not saying I'm 100% better, but I feel so much better than I did 3 weeks ago. I highly recommend asking your doctor if he/she thinks Deplin may help you.
